mcp_servers.description: Map of MCP servers that this AI agent can use.

subagents.description:
Map of subagents for delegating specialized tasks.
Key is the subagent name (used for routing/invocation).

system_prompt.description: System instructions that define how the AI agent should behave and respond.

tags.description:
Tags are key-value pairs that can be assigned to an AI agent resource.
They help organize AI agents and enable filtering when listing them.

url.description: URL to connect to the AI agent endpoint.

id.description: ID of the Redpanda MCP server.

tool_filter_regex.description:
Optional regex pattern to filter which tools from the MCP server should be available.
If not specified, all tools from the MCP server are available.
The pattern is matched against tool names.

AIAgent.State.description:
State of the AI agent.

 - STATE_STARTING: The AI agent is starting.
 - STATE_RUNNING: The AI agent is running and ready to handle requests.
 - STATE_STOPPING: The AI agent is in the process of stopping.
 - STATE_STOPPED: The AI agent is stopped and in paused state.
 - STATE_ERROR: The AI agent encountered an error.

AIAgentCreate.description: AIAgentCreate contains the details for the AI agent creation request.

tags.description: Optional list of tags to attach to an AI agent.

mcp_servers.description: Map of MCP servers that this AI agent can use.

subagents.description:
Map of subagents to add, update, or delete.
If a subagent's value is empty/null, the server interprets that as deletion.

system_prompt.description: System instructions that define how the AI agent should behave and respond.

tags.description:
A map of tags to add, update or delete.
If a tag's value is empty, the server interprets that as a deletion.

config_yaml.description: YAML configuration that defines the AI gateway's behavior, routing rules, and settings.

tags.description:
Tags are key-value pairs that can be assigned to an AI gateway resource.
They help organize AI gateways and enable filtering when listing them.

AIGateway.State.description:
State of the AI gateway.

 - STATE_STARTING: The AI gateway is starting.
 - STATE_RUNNING: The AI gateway is running and ready to handle requests.
 - STATE_STOPPING: The AI gateway is in the process of stopping.
 - STATE_STOPPED: The AI gateway is stopped and in paused state.
 - STATE_ERROR: The AI gateway encountered an error.

AIGatewayCreate.description: AIGatewayCreate contains the details for the AI gateway creation request.

config_yaml.description: YAML configuration that defines the AI gateway's behavior, routing rules, and settings.

tags.description: Optional list of tags to attach to an AI gateway.

A map of tags to add, update or delete.
If a tag's value is empty, the server interprets that as a deletion.

configuration_yamls.description: The configuration schema for the MCP server.

tags.description: Optional list of tags to attach to a pipeline.

LintHint.description: LintHint is a generic linting hint.

tools.description: Map of tool names to their configurations. Each tool contains YAML configuration.

lint_hints.description: Map of tool names to their linting issues. Empty if no issues are found.

name_contains.description: Any AI agents that partially match this name will be returned.

tags[string].description: AI agents that match all the provided tags will be returned.

name_contains.description: Any AI gateways that partially match this name will be returned.

tags[string].description: AI gateways that match all the provided tags will be returned.

name_contains.description: Any KnowledgeBase that partially match this name will be returned.

tags[string].description: KnowledgeBases that match all the provided tags will be returned.

display_name_contains.description: Returns MCP servers that partially match this name.

secret_id.description: Filters MCP servers that reference this secret ID in their tool configurations.

tags[string].description: Filters by tags using exact match. Returns only MCP servers that have all the specified key-value pairs.

next_page_token.description: Token to retrieve the next page of results. Empty if there are no more results.

MCPServer.State.description:
State of the MCP server.

 - STATE_STARTING: The MCP server is starting.
 - STATE_RUNNING: The MCP server is running.
 - STATE_STOPPING: The MCP server is in the process of stopping.
 - STATE_STOPPED: The MCP server is stopped and in paused state.
 - STATE_ERROR: The MCP server encountered an error.

MCPServer.Status.description: MCP server status may contain an error message.

error.description: Error message if the MCP server is in an error state. Empty if no error.

MCPServerCreate.description: MCPServerCreate contains the details for the MCP server creation request.

tags.description: Optional list of tags to attach to a MCP server.

tools.description: Map of tool names to their configurations. Each tool defines a capability that the MCP server exposes.

tags.description:
A map of tags to add, update or delete.
If a tag's value is empty, the server interprets that as a deletion.

tools.description: Map of tool names to their configurations. Each tool defines a capability that the MCP server exposes.

cpu_shares.description:
`cpu_shares` is a string specifying the amount of CPU to allocate for the
pipeline.

This follows the [Kubernetes quantity](https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/kubernetes-api/common-definitions/quantity/) format. Acceptable
units include:
- Decimal SI units: "m" (e.g., "500m" for 500 millicores, "2" for 2 cores)
CPU shares can be specified in millicores (1 core = 1000 millicores).
If you don't specify a unit, the value is interpreted as the number of cores.

memory_shares.description:
`memory_shares` is a string specifying the amount of memory to allocate for
the pipeline.

This follows the [Kubernetes quantity](https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/kubernetes-api/common-definitions/quantity/) format. Acceptable units
include:
- Decimal SI units: "K", "M", "G", "T", "P", "E" (e.g., "128M" for 128
  megabytes)
- Binary SI units: "Ki", "Mi", "Gi", "Ti", "Pi", "Ei" (e.g., "512Mi" for
512 mebibytes) If you don't specify a unit, the value is interpreted as
bytes.

SASLMechanism.description: SASL mechanism to use for authentication.

get.description: List AI agents. Optional: filter based on AI agent name.

parameters.description: Any AI agents that partially match this name will be returned.
parameters.name: filter.name_contains

parameters.description: This is a request variable of the map type. The query format is "map_name[key]=value", e.g. If the map name is Age, the key type is string, and the value type is integer, the query parameter is expressed as Age["bob"]=18
parameters.name: filter.tags[string]

parameters.description: Limit the paginated response to a number of items. Defaults to 50. Use -1 to disable pagination.
parameters.name: page_size

parameters.description:
Value of the next_page_token field returned by the previous response.
If not provided, the system assumes the first page is requested.
parameters.name: page_token

get.description: Returns the configuration schema for MCP server tools, including available components and processors.

post.description: Validates a given MCP tool's configuration and returns linting hints. Each tool's YAML configuration is validated. If no problems are found, the response is empty.

dataplane_api_url.description:
Find the Data Plane API base URL of a cluster by calling the Get Cluster endpoint of the Control Plane API. The dataplane_api.url field is returned in the response body.

Example (Dedicated): "https://api-a4cb21.ck09mi9c4vs17hng9gig.fmc.prd.cloud.redpanda.com"
Example (BYOC): "https://api-a4cb21.ck09mi9c4vs17hng9gig.byoc.prd.cloud.redpanda.com"
